title: Win a group ride with MBUK and Nukeproof
content:
You could win the chance to ride with MBUK, Nukeproof and the Campaign Against Living Miserably (CALM) by entering MBUK‘s group ride prize draw.

The UK’s best-selling mountain bike magazine and leading bike brand Nukeproof have teamed up with suicide prevention charity the Campaign Against Living Miserably (CALM) to run four Ride Together group rides in the UK this autumn.

The guided and supported rides will set off from highly rated trail centres in England and Wales, and all experience levels are welcome.

Laurence Crossman-Emms

While riding solo can be great for mental health, riding with others can be better still, but it can be hard to find riding pals.

The idea behind the Ride Together events is to boost our mood by doing what we love with like-minded enthusiasts.

To be in with a chance of winning your place at a Ride Together group ride and for more information, sign up here.

Laurence Crossman-Emms

The Swinley forest rides will be held on 11 and 12 November at Swinley Bike Hub, but be quick because the group ride entry deadline is 11.59pm on Thursday 26 October. The skill level required will be beginner to intermediate for both dates.

The Forest of Dean rides will be held on 25 and 26 November at Forest of Dean Cycle Centre. Skill level required will be beginner to intermediate and the cut-off to register is 11.59pm on 9 November.

Laurence Crossman-Emms

The last ride will take place in Llandegla Forest’s One Planet Adventure trail centre on 9 and 10 December for beginner and intermediate riders. The last chance to sign up is 11.59pm on 23 November.

If you’re among the lucky winners selected at random closer to the time of the ride, you’ll receive an email asking you to confirm your spot on the ride. There’s also the chance to register for the Ride Together email newsletters series full of mountain biking tips from MBUK, Nukeproof and CALM.
author: Jack Evans
